concept.title: File Processing
concept.shortdesc: The Directory origin processes files in a directory that match the configured file name pattern in lexicographically ascending order.

conbody.p: file processingDirectoryDirectory originfile processingfirst file to processDirectory propertyfile name patternDirectory propertyWhen you define a first file to process, it starts processing with the specified file and continues processing files in lexicographically ascending order. When you do not specify a first file, Directory processes all files in the directory that match the file name pattern.
Configure a first file for processing when you want Directory to ignore older files in the directory.

For example, a file directory includes the following files: File_001.log, File_002.log, File_003.log. If you configure File_002.log as the first file, Directory begins with that file and continues to File_003.log. It does not process File_001.log.

p.note: Note that lexicographically ascending order reads the numbers 1 through 12 as follows: 1, 11, 12, 2, 3, 4... 9

conbody.p: You can add leading zeros to achieve a file naming convention for lexicographical order: 0001, 0002, 0003... 0009, 0010, 0011, 0012
